ai.summary: A 12.8 km moderate hike along a segment of the Cape Wrath Trail from Bealach Ban to Loch Coulin in the UK. The route traverses rugged coastal moorland and hills, with exposed sections and changeable weather, suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal moorland and rocky tracks with exposed viewpoints, uneven footing, boggy patches, and occasional steep grades. Weather and sea wind can be strong; expect panoramic sea and mountain scenery.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours; stay on marked paths; carry a map and compass (or GPS) and know how to use them; inform someone of your route and expected return; bring sufficient water and high-energy food; wear sturdy boots and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer; be mindful of exposed cliff edges, boggy ground, and sudden weather changes; avoid hiking alone in poor conditions and have a plan for emergency communication.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Layered clothing (base layer, fleece, and waterproof outer layer)
Warm hat and gloves for cold conditions
Map and compass (or GPS with offline maps)
Hydration system or 2–3 liters of water
High-energy snacks and a light meal
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Mini first aid kit and blister care
Emergency whistle and space blanket or bivy
Lightweight rain cover for your backpack
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offer the most reliable conditions; winter can be harsh with wind, rain, and limited daylight.

seo.title: Cape Wrath Trail – Bealach Ban to Loch Coulin (12.8 km) | Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore a 12.8 km moderate section of the Cape Wrath Trail (Bealach Ban to Loch Coulin) in the UK. Rugged coastal moorland, exposed ridges, safety tips, and gear to plan your hike.
